articles.author: Andrew Sparrow, Matthew Weaver, Aamna Mohdin, Niall McVeigh, Jamie Grierson, Severin Carrell, Steven Morris, Caroline Davies, Jennifer Rankin
articles.title: UK coronavirus live: 140,000 firms apply for furlough scheme; hospital death toll at 16,509 – as it happened - The Guardian
articles.description: Rishi Sunak says 140,000 gowns have arrived from Myanmar; No 10 says priority is avoiding second peak of infections when it considers easing lockdown
articles.content:
The number of prison staff who have tested positive for Covid-19 rose 40% in three days, a daily update from the Ministry of Justice shows.

articles.author: Max Channon, Rom Preston-Ellis, George Thorpe, Alex Green
articles.title: Coronavirus updates as NHS chief gives face mask warning - Devon Live
articles.description: Scientific advisers for the Government are carrying out a review of the use of face masks
articles.content:
The NHSs supply of face masks could be jeopardised if the Government begins advising the public to wear them, hospital bosses have warned.
Scientific advisers for the Government are carrying out a review of the use of face masks, despite the World Health Org… [+943 chars]

articles.author: Sophie Harris
articles.title: Hay fever or coronavirus: How to tell the difference - signs to look out for - Express
articles.description: HAY FEVER is an allergic reaction to pollen and many Brits suffer with it every year. There are many different symptoms that come with the allergy. However coronavirus and hay fever do share similar symptoms. Here is how to tell the difference between the two.

articles.author: Nisha Mal
articles.title: The way to tell the difference between hay fever and coronavirus - MyLondon
articles.description: Expert advice on the differences from The Royal College of GPs
articles.content:
Hay fever sufferers have been given advice on how to avoid confusing their allergy with signs of coronavirus.
The Royal College of GPs said some people might be concerned that there was an overlap in symptoms.
Its chair, Professor Martin Marshall, said: We … [+2888 chars]
